com.orbitz.monitoring.lib
Class BaseMonitoringEngineManager

java.lang.Object
  com.orbitz.monitoring.lib.BaseMonitoringEngineManager

@ManagedResource(description="Management interface for ERMA MonitoringEngine")
public class BaseMonitoringEngineManager
extends java.lang.Object

Allows MonitoringEngine to be manageable.

Method Detail

addLevelForProcessor

@ManagedOperation(description="Sets a monitoring level on a MonitorProcessor")
@ManagedOperationParameters(value={,})
public void addLevelForProcessor(java.lang.String name,
                                                                             java.lang.String levelStr)
Assign a MonitoringLevel to a MonitorProcessor. MonitorProcessor levels override ProcessGroup levels for every group that contains the processor instance.

Parameters:
name - MonitorProcessor name
levelStr - monitoring level

getInheritableStrategy

public com.orbitz.monitoring.api.InheritableStrategy getInheritableStrategy()
Determines what a Monitor inherits from its parent(s)

Returns:
the strategy

getMonitoringEnabled

public boolean getMonitoringEnabled()
Gets the value that is used to determine whether monitoring will be enabled for the MonitoringEngine when startup() is called.

Returns:
true if monitoring should be enabled for the MonitoringEngine, false otherwise

getOverrideMonitorLevelsListing

@ManagedAttribute(description="Gets a view into monitor level overrides")
public java.lang.String getOverrideMonitorLevelsListing()
Gets the override monitor levels by calling MonitoringEngine.getOverrideMonitorLevelsListing()

Returns:
description of override monitor levels map
See Also:
MonitoringEngine.getOverrideMonitorLevelsListing()

getOverrideProcessorLevelsListing

See Also:
MonitoringEngine.getOverrideProcessorLevelsListing()

getTimerTasks

public java.util.Collection<java.util.TimerTask> getTimerTasks()
Gets the timer tasks that will be scheduled to run every minute when startup() is called.
Note that any timer tasks scheduled to run at any frequency other than one minute will not be returned.

Returns:
the minutely timer tasks

getTimerTasksMap

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<java.util.TimerTask>> getTimerTasksMap()
Gets all timer tasks
  • 60000
    • Task run every minute
    • Task run every minute
    • Task run every minute
  • 1000
    • Task run every second
  • 3600000
    • Task run every hour

Returns:
a map of timer tasks in which the keys are the frequencies, in milliseconds, at which each task is run and values are collections of tasks to run at those frequencies.

reload

public void reload()
Restarts the MonitoringEngine

See Also:
MonitoringEngine.restart()

setInheritableStrategy

public void setInheritableStrategy(com.orbitz.monitoring.api.InheritableStrategy inheritableStrategy)
Sets the strategy that determines whether Monitor attributes are inherited by their children

Parameters:
inheritableStrategy - the strategy

setMonitoringEnabled

public void setMonitoringEnabled(boolean monitoringEnabled)
Sets the value that determines whether the MonitoringEngine will be enabled when startup() is called.

Parameters:
monitoringEnabled - true to enable monitoring, false to cause the MonitoringEngine to ignore all monitors
See Also:
MonitoringEngine.setMonitoringEnabled(boolean)

setStartupRunnable

public void setStartupRunnable(java.lang.Runnable startupRunnable)
Sets the runnable that will be set using MonitoringEngine.setStartupRunnable(Runnable) when startup() is called.

Parameters:
startupRunnable - the startup runnable

setTimerTasks

public void setTimerTasks(java.util.Collection<java.util.TimerTask> timerTasks)
Sets timer tasks that will be executed every minute
Note that this will overwrite existing timer tasks.

Parameters:
timerTasks - timer tasks to set

setTimerTasksMap

public void setTimerTasksMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<java.util.TimerTask>> timerTasks)
Sets the timer tasks

Parameters:
timerTasks - the map of timer tasks, in which keys are the frequencies at which tasks are executed and keys are collections of the tasks to execute at those frequencies
See Also:
getTimerTasksMap()

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Stops all timer tasks and shuts the monitoring engine down.

startup

public void startup()
Sets all properties of the MonitoringEngine that have been configured, such as getMonitoringEnabled() and getInheritableStrategy(), then starts it. After the MonitoringEngine is started, schedules all timer tasks.

updateLevelForMonitor

@ManagedOperation(description="Sets the monitoring level for the monitor(s)")
@ManagedOperationParameters(value={,})
public void updateLevelForMonitor(java.lang.String nameStartsWith,
                                                                              java.lang.String levelStr)
Sets a monitoring level in the MonitoringEngine

Parameters:
nameStartsWith - either the full name of the monitor or a partial string that will be used to match on the beginning of the monitor name
levelStr - string representation of the monitoring level to set
See Also:
MonitoringEngine.addMonitorLevel(String, MonitoringLevel)
